pieces

Class Piece

  • java.lang.Object
    • pieces.Piece
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Bishop, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook

    public abstract class Piece
extends java.lang.Object
    The base piece class that all the pieces inherit from. Provides functionality common to all pieces, such as the piece location, movement, move validity.
    Author:
    Nick, Nithin

      • isValidMove

        public boolean isValidMove(int rDest,
                           int cDest,
                           Board board,
                           char plyr)
        Basic validity checker common to all pieces. Checks to make sure not moving out of board, into a friendly piece, not moving enemy piece, and not moving an empty square. All other piece specific isValid methods call the isValidMove of the Piece class first. The isValidMove method is overridden for each subclass. Each subclass' isValidMove only returns true if the move specified is possible for the specific piece type.

        Pawn: Can move forward vertically by 1, unless another piece is in the way. Can move ahead by 2 steps if in initial row. Cannot move horizontally. Can only capture diagonally in the forward direction. Also checks for enpassant.

        Rook: Can move only horizontally or only vertically. Cannot move past pieces, if piece is in the way, the squares behind it are not valid.

        Knight: can move in 'L' shape as long as not off the board or into friendly piece.

        Bishop: Same as Rook, but only diagonally. |rDest-rCoord| must be equal to |cDest-cCoord|

        King: Can move by 1 step in any direction. If hasMoved is false, can potentially castle if no pieces are in the way.

        Queen: Combination of Rook and Bishop.

        Parameters:
        rDest - destination row coordinate
        cDest - destination column coordinate
        board - the board instance that is being used for the game
        plyr - the player that is making this move
        Returns:
        true if valid move, false otherwise

      • move

        public void move(int r,
                 int c,
                 Board b)
        Simply moves the piece to the location specified by r,c on board b and changes hasMoved to true.
        Parameters:
        r - the row to move to
        c - the column to move to
        b - the board instance moving on
